title: Mountain Biking Epic
tagline: Four days hitting Wales' best trails
suitableFor: Experienced mountain bikers with good fitness and technical skills, comfortable with challenging trails and varied weather conditions.
notSuitableFor: Beginner mountain bikers, those with a fear of heights, or individuals with limited fitness levels.

stops.title: Mountain Biking - Temtiwr
stops.description: Tackle the black-graded Temtiwr trail at Coed y Brenin, known for its technical features and demanding climbs. Expect a challenging ride with rewarding views.

wetAlt.title: Coed y Brenin Visitor Centre
wetAlt.description: Explore the visitor centre, browse the bike shop, and grab a coffee while waiting for the weather to improve.

budgetAlt.title: Mountain Biking - MinorTaur
budgetAlt.description: Ride the easier, blue-graded MinorTaur trail at Coed y Brenin, suitable for a warm-up and less demanding ride.

stops.title: Siop Meurig
stops.description: A traditional cafe in Dolgellau serving hearty Welsh lunches and homemade cakes.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Llyn Cynwch
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own sandwiches with a view of the lake near Dolgellau.

stops.title: Downhill MTB - Antur Stiniog
stops.description: Experience uplift-assisted downhill mountain biking at Antur Stiniog. Choose from various trails catering to different skill levels, from blue to black.

wetAlt.title: Bounce Below
wetAlt.description: Jump and explore massive trampolines in a disused slate mine.

budgetAlt.title: Walking trails around Blaenau Ffestiniog
budgetAlt.description: Explore the unique landscape of the slate quarries on foot.

stops.title: Treks Bunkhouse
stops.description: A comfortable and bike-friendly bunkhouse in Ffestiniog, ideal for groups and solo riders.

budgetAlt.title: Camping at a local campsite
budgetAlt.description: Wild camping is generally not permitted but find a paid campsite near Ffestiniog.

stops.title: BikePark Wales (Drive from Bunkhouse)
stops.description: Drive to South Wales for a day riding at BikePark Wales, offering a huge selection of downhill trails for all abilities. Expect berms, jumps and drops.

wetAlt.title: BikePark Wales Cafe
wetAlt.description: Spend the day in the cafe, watch the riders and plan the next run.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Welsh weather can be unpredictable. Be prepared for rain, wind, and sunshine, even in summer. Check the forecast before you go and pack accordingly.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy, especially on weekends and during school holidays. Allow extra time for travel, especially when driving to popular destinations. Parking at trail centres can fill up quickly, arrive early.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Uplift services at Antur Stiniog and BikePark Wales should be booked in advance, especially during peak season.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: This itinerary requires a good level of fitness. Expect long days of riding on challenging terrain.
